ResponseTemplates.response_templates = {\n # Must be co:
response_templates = {
    # Must be configured
    "application/xml" = <<EOF
#set($inputRoot = $input.path('$'))
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<message>
    $inputRoot.body
</message>
EOF
  }

RestApi.Description: This is a demo api-gw template
RestApi.Name: foo

Requirements.Description: Validate that all security-relevant events for the component are logged and ensure the integrity of collected logs
Ensure the integrity and authenticity of the applicaiton session, and enforce minimum necessary access.
Enforce the access control policy and ensure minimum necessary access
Maintain an accurate asset inventory of all information systems, components, and data
Ensure that secure response headers are set for applications using HTTP
Design a highly available architecture that ensures the availability of essential business functions in accordance with organizational policies and standards
Conduct backups of the information systems and data at frequency consistent with the organization's recovery time and recovery point objectives
Harden the configuration of the component to minimize the attack surface
Protect data in caches to limit the exposure of business sensitive information
Securely wipe sensitive data in memory once that data is no longer needed by the process
Reduce the attack surface by minimizing the collection and aggregation of data
Ensure a proper data retention plan is in place to meet business and compliance needs.
Detect and protect against data mining attacks on data stores
Protect against denial-of-service attacks
Utilize firewalls to control the flow of information
Ensure that the application only accepts valid inputs and any malformed or malicious inputs are rejected
Ensure that all outputs are checked for validity and that they adhere to established types and data formats
Design applications to be fault-tolerant
Uniquely identify and authenticate person and non-person users using protocols that ensure the integrity of the authentication process
Protect authenticators (e.g. passwords, tokens) and manage their lifecycle in a manner commensurate with the access they provide
Integrate with the Single-Sign-On solution

Prevent discovery of application or system information (e.g. IP addresses) and limit feedback to minimum necessary, such that attackers are required to have prior knowledge, or engage in prolonged reconnaissance, to successfully target the application

Isolate and segregate information systems and components from other systems and components based on criteria that, at minimum, includes functionality required, business impact of a breach, threat exposure and the associated business risk profile of the information system and component
Use automation to dynamically isolate and segregate applications or application components in reaction to changing business and security requirements
Configure platforms to provide a separate execution domain for each application thread

Integrate with approved identity lifecycle management capabilities that address the entire lifecycle of the identity and related accounts to ensure that the trust placed in a given identity is commensurate with the risks of that identity being forged, spoofed or compromised
Ensure role-based access control, by organizing access and privileges into roles and managing the lifecycle of these roles in accordance with existing standards & best practices
Enforce separation of duties to reduce the risk of malevolent activity without collusion, commensurate with the business impact of the abuse of an individual's authorized privileges
Apply security policies to, and manage the lifecycle of, all applications that store, process or communicate business sensitive information
Validate that the latest security patches to all systems and applications are applied

Release shared system resources (e.g., registers, main memory, secondary storage) back to the information system, protect them from disclosure to other systems/applications/Users, and prevent Users from intentionally or unintentionally accessing information remnants
Validate configuration of integrity monitoring capabilities
Provide a trusted computing environment for the application
Remediate all known vulnerabilities in Customer Organization systems and applications
Configure  gateways, network routers and access points to appropriately control the flow of network traffic
Configure platforms to control network communications and limit access to only authorized networks and network services
Protect the confidentiality of data using built-in capabilities of the platform
Protect cryptographic keys and manage their lifecycle in a manner commensurate with the business impact of the loss of the key
